intro: Pseudoridolfia, commonly known as the false ridolfia, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Apiaceae. It consists of a single species, Pseudoridolfia scabra, which is native to southern Africa. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels. Its leaves are typically pinnately divided, giving it a feathery appearance. Pseudoridolfia is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
